intro: Leptodermis motsouensis, commonly known as the African rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, rounded leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
